intro: Navarretia fossalis, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in early spring. The plant is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Navarretia fossalis is an annual or biennial species that relies on seasonal snowmelt for germination and growth. Its limited geographic range and specific habitat requirements make it a rare and ecologically significant species.
